*   **ssa (sessile serrated adenoma):** characterized by crypt distortion (irregular shapes and sizes), branching crypts (crypts splitting into multiple branches), goblet cell mucin depletion (fewer or absent goblet cells), and a serrated architecture (saw-tooth appearance) extending to the base of the crypts. crypt bases are often dilated or branched.
